name: grand arches bandana
sizes_available: width 46 cm (18"), length 26 cm (10"), ties 28 cm (11")
notes:
looking for a fun, quick project that's perfect for summer? look no further! this easy crochet bandana is just what you need. using a lovely arch stitch, this bandana is light, airy, and perfect for those warm, sunny days.
what's great about this project is that it only takes one ball of yarn, making it super budget-friendly. plus, you can finish it in just a few hours, so it's perfect for a last-minute gift or a stylish accessory for your next picnic or festival.

please note that this is an ad-free, beautifully formatted, and concise pdf version of a pattern that can be found for free, with ads, on my blog! to view the free version, go to:
https://www.dublinbaycrochet.com/blog/free-crochet-bandana

☑ instant download pdf file for grand arches crochet bandana pattern.
☑ skill level: beginner with or without experience reading patterns as there is a full video tutorial explaining how to make the bandana step by step.
☑ size: width without the ties: 46 cm/ 18 inches
length including the border: 26 cm/ 10 inches
ties: 28 cm/ 11 inches
☑ language: this pattern uses american terms and it is written in english.
☑ you could use any yarn from your stash and play with different colour combinations, here's what you will need:

any 4-ply or sport weight yarn (i used rainbow cotton 8/4 by hobbii yarns
100 % cotton; 50 g (1.75 oz) = 160 m (175 yds)

*pastel purple (041)- color a (1 ball)

you can also use the following brands of yarn:
safran by drops

4 mm crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
tapestry needle
scissors and measuring tape
